title: Accardo
author: Accardo
content: After winning the Finney bitcoin prizes representing His work on bitcoin, Greg's achievements and contributions to the Bitcoin ecosystem surfaced on Pete_rizzo_ page on X regarding Why "Greg Maxwell Is a Bitcoin Legend". First on the long thread (which I'd share a few of it for discussion purposes) before he joined Bitcoin he built protocols like the Opus Codec adopted by streaming platforms like YouTube and Spotify. I went further to check more details on this and found a pdf and article of his where he confirmed building Opus CodecSecond, Greg was a developer but weren't building on the Blockchain until 2011 when he discovered Bitcoin, and didn't consider decentralized consensus on a P2P network realistic. But later began to code and was noticed, in 2012, by a Bitcoin lead developer and promoted to be among the five core developers. Third, Greg found privacy to be an essential property of every monetary and payment system, hence he encouraged other developers to hold tight of privacy. Hence, to strengthen the network's privacy without any modifications Greg, 2013, built a scheme called counjoins to make transactions more difficult to trace. Alongside other beneficial contributions he's made in the Bitcoin network, in 2015,Â  was handed a role of BIP editor, and his respect attracted the interest of other developers and they too ideas to Greg first. He always played the role of a teacher, and a lot of us here have read and learnt from his contributions in matters regarding the forum. Last on this thread (mine) in same year Greg and Adam Back, found a company called blockstream that focus on developing Bitcoin and hiring core developers. All other details regarding why Greg is a btc legend is in the link below. It'll be great to recall that we'll not only participate in Bitcoin by investing money, they're other ways of adding value to the ecosystem just like Greg did when he found Bitcoin. Even non programmers through research and writing can as well pinpoint a means of doing a memorable contribution to Bitcoin. https://x.com/pete_rizzo_/status/1878079505052413965

comments.author: nutildah
comments.body: One of the reason why Bitcoin is as successful as it is today is because of a somewhat immaculate stewardship of the Bitcoin Core repository. It would have been so easy to fumble by letting less-than-stellar changes be made to the software. I'm not saying that everything has been perfect, but the fact the Bitcoin remains the #1 coin by market cap & trading volume - by far and away - means that obviously they've been doing something right for a long while now. Having Greg Maxwell on board was definitely one of those somethings. Cheers Greg ðŸ¥‚

comments.body: saying the market price is due to core code evolution is not a good correlationthe market and financial value of bitcoin is based on the PoW mining minimum costs increasing over time which sets the bottom benchmark of support for the market to then speculate from.. the PoW function is not due to core but code the existed before core was even a thing.. and infact core have at times tried to suppress and cause issues for the mining community including greg trying to mess with asics ability to efficiently mine (the asicboost era)as for you pretending that its merely stewardship, when infact they have full discretion and control of protocol planning and changing, they are more akin to governance not stewardship(or their title of janitor they pretend to hide under), government not stewardstry not to overdo the god like worship, bitcoin needs to actually become more decentralised, less governed, less hero worshipped.. as that was the point of it originally, so lets not celebrate its central governance. people need to be made aware of the negatives so they are fully informed of issues and they can help towards not pushing bitcoin further down a bad direction (by repeating past instances that made certain aspects more centralised), and instead learn from past mistakes and not repeat themEG having the same guy (greg back then) as both chief tech officer, bip controller and technical discussion moderator is 3 pillars too many for one entity.. and now we have achow as CTO, BIP, mod we still have the same centralised problem, infact achow is also the github manager who also decides on the priorities of what gets delegated as the next phases of their roadmap. so 4 pillars in one entities hands.. so not a good thing to just let continue and celebrate and god worship and positively spin into loving stories of perfection and preference
